data: PED SUS buprenorphine-naloxone (Suboxone) 7 Day Microdosing Induction
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Ensure PED SUS Acute Opioid Withdrawal PowerPlan has been ordered prior to completing this PowerPlan

Buprenorphine is an opioid and providers should be familiar with College of Physicians and Surgeons of BC Practice Standards on Safe Prescribing of Opioids and Sedatives and BC Centre for Substance Use Guidelines on Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder
Microdosing allows patients to be started on buprenorphine-naloxone (Suboxone) while concurrently using opioids and thus does not require waiting until withdrawal symptoms occur

Providers may alternatively consider the PED SUS Buprenorphine-Naloxone (Suboxone) Standard Induction PowerPlan for patients in moderate to severe withdrawal OR who do not have opioids in their system
Patient Care
Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale
First 72 hours: Assess subjective cravings or withdrawal symptoms, using COWS scoring if possible, prior to providing each dose of buprenorphine-naloxone, 1 hour after each dose and q3h while awake
Notify Treating Provider
First 72 hours for precipitated withdrawal: Notify provider if COWS score increases 1 or more compared to pre-dose and document COWS q1h
Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale
After 72 hours: Document COWS with vital signs
